Description: Body fragment of large North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery bowl; interiorglazed, fired dull brown-black, with added red band framed in white; exterior: yellow-cream slip, dark brown paint; lotus flowers and buds chain with zone of maeanders in frieze above.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Cook & Dupont, East Greek Pottery (London and New York 1998), p. 46, fig. 8.13(d).
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.111)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
